content.raw:
I think I'll opt for the `_includeWorld` argument. The depth argument is definitely interesting, but I can't come up with a good semantics that is straight forward to use for this PR. I thought of making `depth` the number of ancestors to traverse when generating the name so that a `depth=0` returns the entity name and `depth=1` returns `<parent name><delim><entity name>` and so on. The problem with this is that if I want to just remove the world, I'd have to know the depth of the entity ahead of time, which is not ideal. 

The meaning for `depth` (or something more appropriately named) can be the how many ancestors to remove starting from the world, but I think that'll end up confusing people.
